intro: Pleurothallis ehrhartiiflora, commonly known as the Ehrhart’s orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features narrow, strap-like leaves and produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. Its inflorescence is usually a raceme of small, clustered blooms. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
